name: Tablerender
tagline: A jquery plugin to render table or grid views as server side guys call it with sorting, pagination and theming.
body:
### Table Render Plugin. The plugin automates the creation of tables with data. It provides options for paging , templating headers, templating fields, creating amalgamated columns and lots more. ### Usage *Include jquery.js, tablerender.js and tablerender.css references on your page* ``` ``` *Set up a target container where the plugin needs to render the data* ```
``` *Pass in data and options* Say you have data like this which you need to display ``` var testdata = [ { "ID": 1, "Name": "Aoe", "Address1": "23 Jami street", "datecreated": "\/Date(1239018869048)\/" }, { "ID": 2, "Name": "Jill", "Address1": "31 Napierville", "datecreated": "\/Date(1239018869048)\/" } ] ; ``` your usage is going to be like this ``` $('div.container').tablerender('renderTable', testdata); ``` That's it you have your data rendered - it goes through all the properties and renders them on the page ### Authors and Contributors Vivek Siruvuri (@svivekvarma)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
